Package edu.ntnu.idi.bidata.entity

Class Grocery

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idi.bidata.entity.Grocery
public class Grocery extends Object
This class represents a grocery with the attributes quantity, price, name, expiration date and unit of measurement.
Since:
16.10.2024
Version:
1.0.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Grocery

      public Grocery(BigDecimal quantity, String name, String unit, BigDecimal price, String expiryDate)
      Constructor for the Grocery class. Initializes the quantity, name, unit, and expiry date. The constructor uses setters and getters to reduce duplication.
      Parameters:
      quantity - This is the quantity of the grocery.
      name - This is the name of the grocery.
      unit - This is the unit of measurement that the grocery is measured in.
      price - This is the price of the grocery.
      expiryDate - This is the expiration date of the grocery. Format: 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

  • Method Details

    • getQuantity

      public BigDecimal getQuantity()
      Accessor method for quantity.
      Returns:
      the value of the field, quantity.

    • setQuantity

      public void setQuantity(BigDecimal quantity)
      Mutator method for quantity.
      Parameters:
      quantity - Represents the quantity of a grocery.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if quantity is less than zero, because a negative quantity is not possible.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Accessor method for name.
      Returns:
      The value of name.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Mutator method for name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of a Grocery.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if name is null, blank or empty.

    • getExpiryDate

      public LocalDate getExpiryDate()
      Accessor method for expirationDate.
      Returns:
      the value of expirationDate.

    • setExpiryDate

      public void setExpiryDate(String dateInput)
      Mutator method for expiryDate.
      Parameters:
      dateInput - String parameter that will represent the expiry date on the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if expiration date is not on the correct format.

    • getUnit

      public String getUnit()
      Accessor method for unit.
      Returns:
      the value of field unit.

    • setUnit

      public void setUnit(String unit)
      Mutator method for unit.
      Parameters:
      unit - the unit of measurement that the quantity is measured in. Either liter, kilogram or pcs.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if provided parameter does not match the string value "liter" or "kilogram".

    • getPrice

      public BigDecimal getPrice()
      Accessor method for price.
      Returns:
      the price of the grocery.

    • setPrice

      public void setPrice(BigDecimal price)
      Mutator method for price.
      Parameters:
      price - parameter price that is passed to the field price.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided parameter is less than zero. This is to prevent a negative price.
